articles.headline: Grocery Deliveries in Sharing Economy
articles.snippet: Instacart matches independent contractors who are good at grocery shopping with customers too busy to shop for themselves.
articles.abstract: Instacart matches independent contractors who are good at grocery shopping with customers too busy to shop for themselves.
articles.lead_paragraph: “I hope you realize that you are about to witness a remarkable display in ineptitude,” the technology investor Michael J. Moritz said as he entered a Whole Foods store in San Francisco one recent afternoon.

articles.headline: In Credit Suisse Settlement, a Question of Justice
articles.snippet: Although Credit Suisse is paying stiff penalties as part of its convictions, many critics have been left disappointed by what the plea deal didn’t do.
articles.abstract: Although Credit Suisse is paying stiff penalties as part of its convictions, many critics have been left disappointed by what the plea deal didn’t do.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated, 3:44 p.m. | Hours after the Obama administration announced the criminal conviction of Credit Suisse on Monday evening, the bank’s chief executive, Brady W. Dougan, publicly reassured Wall Street that the punishment would not do much damage to his firm. The conviction, he said on a conference call, would not cause “any material impact on our operational or business capabilities.”

articles.headline: Web Retailer JD.com’s I.P.O. Shows a Hunger for China
articles.snippet: The initial public offering for JD.com raised $1.78 billion, valuing the company at nearly $26 billion and whetting investors’ appetites for an Alibaba I.P.O.
articles.abstract: The initial public offering for JD.com raised $1.78 billion, valuing the company at nearly $26 billion and whetting investors’ appetites for an Alibaba I.P.O.
articles.lead_paragraph: The biggest test yet of American investors’ appetite for a Chinese Internet company has passed with flying colors — and it doesn’t involve the Alibaba Group, that country’s e-commerce giant.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Seeking Balance on Mideast Visit, Pope Pleases Few
articles.snippet: Pope Francis plans a strong show of support for a Palestinian state this weekend, when he becomes the first pontiff to travel directly to the occupied West Bank without passing through Israel.
articles.abstract: Pope Francis plans a strong show of support for a Palestinian state this weekend, when he becomes the first pontiff to travel directly to the occupied West Bank without passing through Israel.
articles.lead_paragraph: BETHLEHEM, West Bank — Pope Francis plans to give a strong show of support for a sovereign Palestinian state when he makes his first visit to the Holy Land this weekend, becoming the first pontiff to travel directly into the occupied West Bank rather than passing through Israel.
articles.byline: By Jodi Rudoren and Isabel Kershner

articles.headline: U.S. Seeks Disclosure of All Fees Fliers Face
articles.snippet: A proposed rule from the Transportation Department would require airlines and travel agents to list fees for services like checked bags, carry-ons and seat reservations so that travelers could compare fares more easily.
articles.abstract: A proposed rule from the Transportation Department would require airlines and travel agents to list fees for services like checked bags, carry-ons and seat reservations so that travelers could compare fares more easily.
articles.lead_paragraph: Airlines and travel agents will be required to list fees for services like checked bags, carry-ons and seat reservations so that travelers can compare fares more easily under a proposal announced by the Transportation Department on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Airbnb Will Hand Over Host Data to New York
articles.snippet: The New York state attorney general will get the information he is seeking about Airbnb hosts in New York City, but it will be stripped of names and addresses.
articles.abstract: The New York state attorney general will get the information he is seeking about Airbnb hosts in New York City, but it will be stripped of names and addresses.
articles.lead_paragraph: Airbnb, the apartment sharing service, and New York law enforcement officials came to an agreement Wednesday after a dispute over rental data that lasted for the better part of a year.

articles.headline: Where ‘Say Nothing’ Is Gospel, I.R.A. Victim’s Daughter Is Talking
articles.snippet: A daughter of Jean McConville, who was abducted and killed 42 years ago, has filed suit against Sinn Fein, whose leader, Gerry Adams, was questioned over the murder.
articles.abstract: A daughter of Jean McConville, who was abducted and killed 42 years ago, has filed suit against Sinn Fein, whose leader, Gerry Adams, was questioned over the murder.
articles.lead_paragraph: BELFAST, Northern Ireland — Helen McKendry was shopping recently when she spied a former neighbor who she is sure was one of the members of the Irish Republican Army who burst into her home 42 years ago and abducted her mother.

articles.headline: China’s Global Search for Energy
articles.snippet: China has an insatiable appetite for energy and it has made deals with nations like Russia, Iraq, Nigeria, Ecuador and Venezuela to keep its people warm and the lights on.
articles.abstract: China has an insatiable appetite for energy and it has made deals with nations like Russia, Iraq, Nigeria, Ecuador and Venezuela to keep its people warm and the lights on.
articles.lead_paragraph: Whether by diplomacy, investment or in extreme cases, force, China is going to great lengths to satisfy its growing hunger for energy to fuel its expanding car fleet and electrify its swelling cities.
articles.byline: By Clifford Krauss and Keith Bradsher

articles.headline: Rent or Buy? The Math Is Changing
articles.snippet: In expensive places like California and the Northeast, buying a home again looks like a perilous investment.
articles.abstract: In expensive places like California and the Northeast, buying a home again looks like a perilous investment.
articles.lead_paragraph: Billy Gasparino and Jenna Dillon-Gasparino were savvy enough to wait out the housing boom of a decade ago as renters. Not until 2010, well into the bust, did they buy a house in the Venice neighborhood of Los Angeles, less than a mile from the beach, for $810,000.

articles.headline: With New Bill, Abortion Limits Spread in South
articles.snippet: Louisiana’s legislature has followed in the path of several other southern states with new rules that require doctors performing abortions to have admitting privileges at hospitals.
articles.abstract: Louisiana’s legislature has followed in the path of several other southern states with new rules that require doctors performing abortions to have admitting privileges at hospitals.
articles.lead_paragraph: BATON ROUGE, La. — The Louisiana State Legislature on Wednesday passed a bill that could force three of the state’s five abortion clinics to close, echoing rules passed in Alabama, Mississippi and Texas and raising the possibility of drastically reduced access to abortion across a broad stretch of the South.
articles.byline: By Jeremy Alford and Erik Eckholm

articles.headline: Thailand’s Military Stages Coup, Thwarting Populist Movement
articles.snippet: The move was the culmination of months of maneuvering by the Bangkok establishment to sideline a populist movement that has won every national election since 2001.
articles.abstract: The move was the culmination of months of maneuvering by the Bangkok establishment to sideline a populist movement that has won every national election since 2001.
articles.lead_paragraph: BANGKOK — The Thai military seized control of the country on Thursday and detained at least 25 leading politicians in a culmination of months of maneuvering by the Bangkok establishment to sideline a populist movement that has won every national election since 2001.

articles.headline: Some Privacy, Please? Facebook, Under Pressure, Gets the Message
articles.snippet: The move responds to complaints that the service’s privacy settings are too complicated and that people often don’t know who can see what they’re posting.
articles.abstract: The move responds to complaints that the service’s privacy settings are too complicated and that people often don’t know who can see what they’re posting.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Do you know who can see what you are posting on Facebook, including your photos, birthday and personal cellphone number?

articles.headline: Sears Posts Worst Report of a Bad Lot in Retailing
articles.snippet: Sears Holdings’s dismal earnings report not only lacked signs of improvement but also laid bare how few options the company had left.
articles.abstract: Sears Holdings’s dismal earnings report not only lacked signs of improvement but also laid bare how few options the company had left.
articles.lead_paragraph: The slide continued on Thursday for the deeply troubled Sears Holdings, whose dismal earnings report not only lacked signs of improvement but also laid bare how few options the company had left.
